channel.title: Help with some coding on new skillcape hoods
channel.description: before you go saying that I don't have it in the right place in item.java, go home. If you notice when you fix the hoods and put them so your hair doesn't show it affects the characters jaw, the reason this is happening is because when you either put the hood in fullmask or full helm, it interprets that the hood should cover your whole face and is not showing the jaw. There has been many global object issues like this in the past, please help, I'm no good at global objects and if you can help I would like to ask permission to post this as a tutorial to help others ( you will receive full credit)

item.title: Help with some coding on new skillcape hoods
item.dc:creator: @elweb elweb
item.description:
@elweb wrote:

s t r, my favourite thing to do is figure out all the quirks in item.java to make items look good, in other words i’ve tried everything

Read full topic

item.description:

Have you added the hoods ID to both mask and helm? or just one because that may be the problem.People told me i had to add it to both when i tried to fix that ^^

item.title: Help with some coding on new skillcape hoods
item.dc:creator: @elweb elweb
item.description:
@elweb wrote:

before you go saying that I don’t have it in the right place in item.java, go home. If you notice when you fix the hoods and put them so your hair doesn’t show it affects the characters jaw, the reason this is happening is because when you either put the hood in fullmask or full helm, it interprets that the hood should cover your whole face and is not showing the jaw. There has been many global object issues like this in the past, please help, I’m no good at global objects and if you can help I would like to ask permission to post this as a tutorial to help others ( you will receive full credit)

Read full topic
item.source: Help with some coding on new skillcape hoods
